com.jacobschneider.engine.input

Class InputHandler

  • Object
    • InputHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    KeyListener, EventListener

    public class InputHandler
extends Object
implements KeyListener
    Basic input handler. Add this as a listener to the form that you are using and then map keys to actions by calling mapAction(int, EngineAction).
    Author:
    Jacob

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  InputHandler.EngineAction
      List of currently supported actions that you can map too.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      InputHandler() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addListener(InputListener listener)
      Any class that you want to respond to key events must implement InputListener and be added here.
      void keyPressed(KeyEvent key) 
      void keyReleased(KeyEvent key) 
      void keyTyped(KeyEvent key) 
      void mapAction(int keyCode, InputHandler.EngineAction action)
      Maps a key to an action.

        public InputHandler()

    • Method Detail

      • mapAction

        public void mapAction(int keyCode,
                      InputHandler.EngineAction action)
        Maps a key to an action.
        Parameters:
        keyCode - Integer representation of a KeyEvent. Can be found from a KeyEvent by calling KeyEvent.getKeyCode() or by looking at the static public int fields in KeyEvent.
        action - The action you want to map the keyCode to.

      • addListener

        public void addListener(InputListener listener)
        Any class that you want to respond to key events must implement InputListener and be added here.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener you want to add.

      • keyPressed
